intro: Ribes rosthornii, commonly known as the Rostrhorn currant, is a deciduous shrub native to the western United States. It belongs to the genus Ribes, which includes various species of flowering plants in the family Grossulariaceae. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a serrated margin. Ribes rosthornii produces small, edible berries that are typically red or black in color, similar to other currant species.
